name: Shallow soft (temp) - Shallow sand or mud bottom (<40 m depth) - ecosystem component from the WIO Symphony tool
description: A seafloor substrate model, developed by C. Jenkins with regional support from S. Fennessy, was applied, together with the dbSEABED database. Sand-mud proportions were combined to create a soft bottom layer. The shallow zone was defined as 0-40 m using GEBCO 2022 data, and yearly average SST (Sea Surface Temperature) from Copernicus data was used to model the temperate zone with a linear ramp-up starting at 25.5 °C (e.g. temp zone = 0) ending at 23 °C (e.g. temp zone = 1). Known limitations: The underlying substrate and bathymetry models are uncertain in most areas of the WIO region.

citation: Kågesten G, Jenkins C, Fennessy S, Queste B, WIO Symphony team,  2023, Shallow soft (temp) - ecosystem component from the WIO Symphony tool, https://github.com/WIOSymphony/
